intro: Eriogonum brachypodum, commonly known as the shortpod buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pinkish to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Eriogonum brachypodum plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small animals.
